citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection one adult dog was found with an untreated ear condition consistent with an ear infection. King, an
approximately 7-year-old male King Charles Cavalier (M/C#933000320032781) was observed with a slight head tilt to the
left, a scab on the outside and behind the left ear. On closer observation, the area around the scab was red and had dried
brown discharge. The inside of the left ear appeared red, moist and inflamed with thick yellow creamy discharge.
Poor ear health can cause pain and discomfort on the dog and have a negative impact on the animal’s wellbeing.
This dog must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment
plan. Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that includes preventive care and
treatment to ensure healthy ears for all dogs.
To be corrected by: May 16, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During the inspection one adult dog was found with an untreated ear condition consistent with an ear infection. King, an 
approximately 7-year-old male King Charles Cavalier (M/C#933000320032781) was observed with a slight head tilt to the 
left, a scab on the outside and behind the left ear. On closer observation, the area around the scab was red and had dried 
brown discharge. The inside of the left ear appeared red, moist and inflamed with thick yellow creamy discharge.  
 
Poor ear health can cause pain and discomfort on the dog and have a negative impact on the animal’s wellbeing.  
 
This dog must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment 
plan. Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that includes preventive care and 
treatment to ensure healthy ears for all dogs. 
 
To be corrected by: May 16, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
